Game.plot: Critical ReceptionGame Informer gave the review scores of 6 and 5.5. Kato, who gave the higher score wrote, "...per the usual Army Men game I was running around frantically in order to aim properly. Holding down the R shoulder button fixes your orientation, but oftentimes you're so surrounded by foes it's not practical. On the other hand, I wish the environments were cluttered with scenery. There is little here that pushes the handheld's power. Multiplayer? That's MIA.Reiner wrote, "...As hard as it may seem to believe, Army Men Advance is actually decent. Game.Notes: Plastro, the infamous leader of the Tan Army, has recruited alien forces from another world to aid in his ongoing war against the Green Nation. It's up to Sarge and Vikki G. to jump into action to save their troops from a variety of unknown enemies, and then track down Plastro himself for a final confrontation!
